intro: Dissochaeta inappendiculata var. purpurascens, commonly known as the purple-stemmed dissochaeta, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems that often display a distinctive purplish hue. Its small, white to pink flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. This species is often found in open woodlands and grasslands, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
